document_data.caption: A set of block and tackle.
document_data.name: Block and Tackle
document_data.mainbody: A '''block and tackle''' was a set of [[rope]]s and [[pulley]]s that enabled a user to vertically lift objects heavier than their strength would normally be capable of lifting.
document_data.Description:
A block and tackle typically consisted of a set of square, wooden blocks with greased internal wheels. These blocks were attached to something, such as a wall or tree branch, by multiple straps and harnesses in order to securely suspend it above the desired object. Finally, a rope, typically {{SI|50|ft|long=yes}} in length, was then threaded through these series of internal wheels

A block and tackle was commonly sold in three different weight classes. A light version was capable of lifting objects less than {{SI|200|lbs.|k|long=yes}}, a medium version was capable of lifting objects up to {{SI|1000|lbs.|k|long=yes}}, and a heavy version was capable of lifting objects up to {{SI|5000|lbs.|k|long=yes}} in weight.
document_data.Availability:
* In [[Athkatla]], one could find block and tackles for sale at the market [[Waukeen's Promenade]].<ref><ref group="note" name="Duty">''[[For Duty & Deity]]'' states that every nonmagical item featured in the ''[[Arms and Equipment Guide]]'' can be purchased at Waukeen's Promenade.
* In [[Zhentil Keep]], one could find block and tackles for sale at [[Lita's Equipment]].<ref><ref group="note" name="Lita">''[[Ruins of Zhentil Keep]]'' states that everything from the ''Arms and Equipment Guide'', except for arms and armor, can be purchased at Lita's Equipment.
document_data.History:
Some time between the First and Second [[Mulhorand]]i Empires, around {{Yearlink|-1048}} to {{Yearlink|-105}}, people in the land of Mulhorand invented the block and tackle system. This enabled them to construct buildings with greater ease.

In the {{YearlinkName|1174}}, the [[Lords of Waterdeep]] construct a massive system of blocks and tackles that they dubbed "the hoist." A system capable of lifting and manipulating seagoing vessels into or out of the locks that led to and from [[Waterdeep]]'s underground neighbor, the city of [[Skullport]].<ref>
document_data.Notable Users: A block and tackle was a common tool in the skill of stonemasonry.<ref>
